title: Serverpod Setup Knowledge Check
description: Test your understanding of Serverpod project structure and setup.

questions.text: What are the three packages created when you run 'serverpod create my_app'?
questions.explanation: Serverpod creates three packages: my_app_server (the backend), my_app_client (generated client library), and my_app_flutter (sample Flutter app). The client package is auto-generated from the server code.

questions.text: Which command regenerates the client code after modifying server endpoints?
questions.explanation: The 'serverpod generate' command regenerates all auto-generated code, including the client package. You should run this after modifying endpoints or protocol definitions.

questions.text: What services does Docker run for Serverpod development?
questions.explanation: Serverpod uses PostgreSQL as its database and Redis for caching and session storage. Both are containerized using Docker for easy local development.

questions.text: Where do you define data models in a Serverpod project?
questions.explanation: Serverpod uses YAML files in the lib/src/protocol/ directory to define data models. From these YAML definitions, Serverpod generates Dart classes for both server and client.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the my_app_client package?
options: It contains the Flutter UI components
It is a generated package that Flutter apps import to call server endpoints
questions.explanation: The my_app_client package is automatically generated from your server code. Flutter apps import this package to get type-safe access to all server endpoints and data models.
